timeline.message: DBZ-1052 Transaction metadata for SQL Server

timeline.author: gunnarmorling

timeline.bodyText: As that's a user-facing topic -- unlike heartbeats -- I'd suggest to stick to the established naming pattern for topics and make it <logical name>.transactions, e.g. dbserver1.transactions.
timeline.author: gunnarmorling

timeline.bodyText: Have you tested this? I'd expect that the nested attributes will need proper handling, i.e. prefixing them with with some constant literal as they are all put into one flat namespace. That said I'm a bit dubious about the nested structure begin with. This ties into my question about the purpose of these attributes in change events themselves. I kinda thought we'd only need the TX id, in which case the question of nesting is a moot point.
timeline.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText: Yes, CE test fails due to this reason, thus I added this as a hotfix - for whether we need or not other information please see other comment.
replies.author: jpechane

replies.bodyText: Removed as transaction is no longer in source info block
replies.author: jpechane

timeline.bodyText: Please add a comment, as it's a public contract and it'll be beneficial for us, too.
timeline.author: gunnarmorling

timeline.bodyText: This situation of COMMIT and next BEGIN sharing the same LSN sounds really weird. Is this something you actually observed, too, @jpechane ?
timeline.author: gunnarmorling
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -130,13 +131,6 @@ public boolean shouldMessageBeSkipped(ByteBuffer buffer, Long lastReceivedLsn, L
                     // same session a `R` message was followed by an insert/update/delete message.
                     // @formatter:on
                 case COMMIT:
-                    // For now skip these message types so that the LSN associated with the message won't
-                    // be flushed back to PostgreSQL. There is a potential LSN assignment concern with
-                    // ReplicationConnectionIT#testHowRelationMessagesAreReceived where the first COMMIT

replies.bodyText: @gunnarmorling No, I've not encountered yet. I've discussed the matter with @Naros and we came to conclusion that if the problem is no longer viisble in tests that we can remove it.
replies.author: jpechane

timeline.author: gunnarmorling

timeline.bodyText: Good; that should help with other non-CDC events, too.
timeline.author: gunnarmorling

timeline.bodyText: Can you also add (or update) the example event shown in the converter docs?
timeline.author: gunnarmorling

timeline.bodyText: There is iodebeziumtxId already (see above). That's really what I'm a bit concerned about -- the redundancy of this new info. I don't have a good answer right now. Maybe we should deprecate and eventually remove the current txId attribute in the source block?
timeline.author: gunnarmorling
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -97,6 +101,9 @@ Alternatively, Avro can be used as content type for the `data` attribute:
   "iodebeziumtxId" : "578",
   "iodebeziumlsn" : "33227720",
   "iodebeziumxmin" : null,
+  "iodebeziumtxid": "589",

replies.bodyText:
@gunnarmorling I don't think that it is necessary to remove the redundancy. Don't forget that transaction metadata are optional. So I'd keep it in source info.
In fact this looks like a problem only in flattened format and in this case I propose to just document it and/or change iodebeziumtx to a different one so the difference is more visible, maybe iodebeziumTxn?
replies.author: jpechane

DBZ-1052 Expand known protobuf messages list

timeline.bodyText: Isn't the early return a problem as we'd miss the update of lastCompletelyProcessedLsn below?
timeline.author: gunnarmorling

timeline.bodyText: Ok, so I'm still not happy about this; but no blocker for now. I've added it to DBZ-1701 to get rid of iodebeziumtxId if iodebeziumtxid is present.
timeline.author: gunnarmorling
